meanings.definition: To create a new dance routine for a performance.
meanings.sent1: The dance group rechoreographed their routine for the talent show.
meanings.sent2: She rechoreographed the ballet to make it more exciting for the audience.
meanings.sent3: The penguins rechoreographed their waddle to impress the zoo visitors.
meanings.sent4: The wind rechoreographed the leaves, swirling them into a beautiful dance.
meanings.sent5: The chef rechoreographed the kitchen, turning it into a culinary performance.

meanings.definition: To change the steps of a dance routine.
meanings.sent1: They rechoreographed the salsa dance to include more spins.
meanings.sent2: After feedback, the instructor rechoreographed the routine for better flow.
meanings.sent3: The robots rechoreographed their dance, causing a glitch in their system.
meanings.sent4: The storm rechoreographed the waves, creating a mesmerizing dance of water.
meanings.sent5: The artist rechoreographed the painting, adding new colors and shapes.

meanings.definition: The act of altering a choreographed dance.
meanings.sent1: The rechoreography of the performance brought a fresh energy to the stage.
meanings.sent2: She studied the rechoreography of the classic ballet to understand its evolution.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful rechoreography of the dance amused the family.
meanings.sent4: The rechoreography of the city streets at night gave them a magical quality.
meanings.sent5: The rechoreography of the garden transformed it into a vibrant dance of colors.
